Cardiff: banned from recruitment for the next three mercatos?
According to The Telegraph, FIFA would ban Cardiff from recruiting for the next three mercatos if the Welsh club does not pay for the transfer of Emiliano Sala, tragically missing earlier this year.
04 Nov 2019, 12:20 by Florian Sermaise

Nantes: the possible eleven




What will be the outcome of the dispute between Cardiff and FC Nantes? According to The Telegraph, FIFA, in charge of settling the case, would be in the process of agreeing to the French club. In the midst of the legal battle in the context of the settlement of the transfer of Emiliano Sala, tragically disappeared earlier this year while the latter was traveling by plane across the Channel, the FIFA Players' Status Committee would have rejected all the arguments of Welsh training.




"The player was a Cardiff player"




The Welsh public paid tribute to the late striker + 12 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

Cardiff is refusing to pay for the transfer of the Argentine, whose plane crashed at sea last January when he was heading to Wales. "The transfer of the player from Nantes to Cardiff must be regarded as validly concluded by both parties, and as a result the player was a Cardiff player" at the time of his disappearance, writes the Commission's report according to The Telepraph. In this perspective, the commission threatens the Welsh recruiting club for the next three mercatos if the leaders of the Bluebirds do not pay the 6 million euros to FC Nantes, ordered by the world football body in late September. Cardiff, who then had 45 days, intends to appeal to the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS).
